content:
Should clarify that lengthMin and lengthMax won't appear multiple times in the conditions.

This is a really hard clash, especially for Shortest mode, where a lot of things aren't clear, so you can't tell if it's ok to take shortcuts.

In my clash just now, no one could solve it. I won with 80% and spent the full 15 minutes attempting to solve it.
https://www.codingame.com/clashofcode/clash/report/41346227f6a71293457a76615106845ce85af16

In the end, I was stumped because I'd mistakenly assumed that if a character appears in both "Include" and "Exclude" then there's an "ERROR", but as long as ALL the Include characters aren't in Exclude, then it's still possible to make a valid password.

I think this clash is unnecessarily complicated and difficult. It would be better if you kept it simple in my opinion, as right now it's almost impossible to understand and solve in 15 minutes - let alone the 5 minutes a clash is meant to be solvable within...

Doesn't work great in shortest mode because the constraints are not clear and there's relatively few test cases. We just had this in shortest mode on a stream and not a single one of the 11 players got 100%.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Unusual and easy!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The description is very clear and problem is solvable in under 5 mins. Approving.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good for CoC
It depends on the programming language you're trying to solve it in. There are simpler solutions available in python3 that should take you way less than 15 minutes to solve.
I think it is doable in the given time by using regex. I like the idea of multiple validations.

I find this exercise a bit long for 15 minutes.

The problem is very easy, but the number of cases to consider will leave many players without a chance to even finish their solution.

*I think you should limit the conditions to one per type, with a fixed pattern (total lines in input : 5). 

Example (modified Test 4):
  tVIDyBF/xz4j:
  5
  15
  0123456789_
  !;,?.

*This should make the code shorter to write, without changing the core of the problem (validity, contradictions).

Nice challenge, by the way !
Oh the multiple include / exclude conditions are sneaky, love it!
A really useful topic. I think you can use regex for some conditions like include and exclude.

What confused me is that I thought multiple conditions of the same types were cumulative but that wasn't the case. 
It could be a good challenge for shortest mode also.

Input section
* Please follow the example in the contribution guidelines in presenting the section.
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines
In particular, please include line numbers and variable types.

Output section
* Same comment as above.
* Please consider formatting the possible outputs as constants using the syntax of {{x}} e.g. {{VALID}}.
* You need not repeat the explanation here.

Thanks.
Thank you for the advice, i changed it.

upvoting for shortest mode as well. i hate when there are so many one-line tasks like for example when you simply need to reduce-XOR operations on array, or do a simple formula calculation where there is no room for any interesting code golfing tricks, but puzzles like this are rarely included
Agreed, contradictory conditions overcomplicate this problem.

Same issue , the best score was 80%, while my tests passed 100%

You should change the last test to have the type than the validator. (VALID with some char in both conditions include an exclude)
Thanks for the advice, i added it. Feel free to let me know if I should improve anything else.
